Package aima.core.search.informed

Class AStarEvaluationFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.search.informed.HeuristicEvaluationFunction
      • aima.core.search.informed.AStarEvaluationFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EvaluationFunction
    public class AStarEvaluationFunction
extends HeuristicEvaluationFunction
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 93.

    The most widely known form of best-first search is called A* search (pronounced "A-star search"). It evaluates nodes by combining g(n), the cost to reach the node, and h(n), the cost to get from the node to the goal:
            f(n) = g(n) + h(n).
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone, Ruediger Lunde
